body: This PR only relocates the pages and doesn't change any content.
Just a few comments. The documentation looks very good overall

Okay, I have rebased an excessive number of times to clean up the history, and have no further questions.

Feel free to merge :)
problem is visible when using grant/revoke permissions
@XiaoZYang thank you for reporting. this should be fixed now.
@jerrypeng I have addressed all your comments.
will sync this change back to new website.

retest this please

// 2.1.0-incubating is at maven central now

@jiazhai 帮我review一下
有个问题  增加了一些指标，指标太多可能导致内存溢出。是否需要加个配置，默认将订阅和消费者的指标关闭
@codelipenghui, Agree with your comments, It is a good idea to have a config to control these stats for  subscriptions and consumers.
@sijie @merlimat  Would you please help review this?
fyi please hold on merging this until I cut over 2.1 website.
@massakam can you share more logs about this issue? trying to see if we can find anything interesting in the log about why the broker can't connect to zookeeper.
#2294 is the pull request for this issue.

@merlimat @srkukarni @jerrypeng : since this is an initial change for Pulsar SQL, if there is no major concerns, I would suggest moving forward with merging this PR. so once it is merged, other stuffs can happen in parallel, such as packaging, integration tests, documentation, release plan and such.
Close this one since it is not active, and we will be on the new website after 2.1.0 release. so have to redo this work anyway.
Close this one since it is not active, and we will be on the new website after 2.1.0 release. so have to redo this work anyway.
ping @merlimat and @jiazhai . lets give some feedback to @gordeevbr , so that we can move forward with the change here.

> One broad comment is that can we remove metrics from getstatus method?

metrics api is used by a monitoring system to monitor worker-level activities.
However, we still require api to query metrics for a specific function same way we always query metrics of topic `./pulsar-admin persistent stats <topic>`. 
is there any reason to not provide api for function level metrics ?
Move to [#2299](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/2299). so close this pull request

@massakam what's the zk timeout?
do you have zk gc logs/stats? it seems you have zk-timeout 30 seconds. can you increase zk-timeout to 60 seconds and also try to get zk gc stats?

@aahmed-se @sijie It seems [PulsarFunctionsTest.setup](https://builds.apache.org/job/pulsar_precommit_integrationtests/3081/testReport/) is failing. In this PR, we are making sure that function [web-server](https://github.com/rdhabalia/pulsar/blob/048a2bed8cc33b38481c988365d87d7761f0b1b3/pulsar-functions/worker/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/functions/worker/Worker.java#L152) gets destroyed when we stop the worker service.  I tested locally and it shutdowns and cleans resources gracefully so, do you know what exactly causing integration-test failure?
@rdhabalia The test is not failing it can't get started , there are not enough resources to start the multiple containers needed to run the test.

@rdhabalia I don't think it is failing. don't worry about that at this moment. it doesn't block merging.

I will take a look at improving integration tests next week since I will be out of 2.1.0 release.

thanks @sijie @aahmed-se.
@sijie I have made few changes after you reviewed the PR. can you please give another look for new changes.
asked on twitter, jclouds will have a release 2.1.1 in next week.
looks good to me. are you planning to add the config to python as well?

Thanks for your feedback.
Yes, I believe I have messed up some tests with this. I shall fix this as soon as possible.

@rdhabalia 
> what's the zk timeout?

zooKeeperSessionTimeoutMillis is set to 30000.

> do you have zk gc logs/stats?

We don't have them... I will share if I get them.
Is it just trying to use HTTP?
not sure. but i checked the connection code, and it doesn't pull any tls auth stuff

@srkukarni @sijie @jerrypeng @merlimat @jai1 
addressed the change regarding endpoint. can you please give another look.

Found the reason for this issue.

In zookeeper data of path named " /admin/policies/public/functions" has "replication_clusters":["standalone"]

When i set it to my cluster name "pulsar-qa". I can start the broker success.
To change config pulsarFunctionsCluster in functions_worker.yml

@codelipenghui that's correct. the `functions_worker.yml` was shipped for standalone deployment. It has to be updated for cluster deployment. Let me improve the documentation on how to enable function worker in cluster mode in #2327

Sally from ASF press has reviewed it. There is no legal issue from ASF to host a blog under *.apache.org.

Since there is no other review comments, I will go ahead to merge it.

@codelipenghui : 

in zookeeper 3.5, zookeeper will start an admin server at 8080. that's why the port of 8080 is used.
what you can do is adding following settings to the zookeeper configuration file. you can either disable zookeeper admin server, or changing the admin server port to a different port (e.g. 9990).

```
admin.enableServer=true
admin.serverPort=9990
```

I have a pull request #2331 on adding them to configuration files.
Closed the issue. Since the problem was addressed by updating `functions_worker.yml`, #2327 will be used for tracking the documentation updates.
This feature indeed make sense. Is it possible for you to to volunteer to add this functionality?

Hi,
Just tried it from pulsar master(your logs indicated that you were on 2.2.0-incubating) and was able to start the function. Which exact pulsar branch/head that you saw this error?

master branch on monday.
